> Error 503: Backend Error, backendError

That is a google internal error.  I don't know what causes that.

Does a retry fix it, or does it always give that error?

> > Error 503: Backend Error, backendError
> 
> That is a google internal error. I don't know what causes that.
> 
> Does a retry fix it, or does it always give that error?

Thanks for your replay,  retry it but always gives an error. 

I forgot to mention that I am copying data between the same Google cloud disk. This file is 3G size, I find  this error occurs if the copied file is larger. But It is normal when I was operating on the web side of Google drive.

I try to run the follow code and the file size to be copied is 45G.

>rclone copy -vv --dump bodies --retries 1 gdswccd:SHE gdswccd:test

There are other people reporting difficulties copying very big files in [this thread on the google forums](https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/drive/OgnC30vb8bM;context-place=mydiscussions).

This must be some kind of google limit but I don't know what.

If you don't mind downloading and re-uploading the data you can use `--disable Copy`.

I read this discussion but it is  strange that I using another chrom app "copy, url to google drive'.  This app also needs to get my verification id but there are no errors. I think the reason for the error should be 'rclone' regards the copy between remote as a local upload to the remote. So the error rateLimitExceeded will appear.

I'm seeing the same issues copying between two Team Drives, it's not any kind of rate limit. Just an unhelpful 'Backend Error' for bigger files. ``` $ rclone ls drive1: 3956080640 bigtestfile 5 test ```

issue.title: Google Drive server side copies error 500, 503

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I'm trying to do a server side copy of a 41 GB folder of 20 files. Every time I try to do that I get Error 503: Backend Error and Error 500: Internal Error. Sometimes a few files will copy at first, but that's all it does. This command worked fine for me up until about three weeks ago, and has not worked since. rename.to: drive: large server side copies failing with 500 error

body:
I'm not sure what to do about this.  It seems to be a problem at the google drive end.  Rclone uses the [v3 copy API](https://developers.google.com/drive/api/v3/reference/files/copy) and nowhere in that is mention of file size limits.

I suspect it is an internal timeout when copying the very large file.

Having the same problem, rclone gets stuck when trying to copy 10 specific files and -vv shows backend error.
Sizes range is between 1GB and 15GB.
AirExplorer can copy them just fine.

> AirExplorer can copy them just fine.
without download?

same issue with .m2ts files (any size). 
copied mkv files to almost 50 gb, there were no problems. copied instantly

issue.title: rclone 1.48 drive side copy, with Google Drive in DSM is not working

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

The Rclone Developers

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When I try a server side copy in DSM, with flag --drive-server-side-across-configs, doesn't works, neither with rclone 1.47, without flag, it doesn't works, It tries to copy, but finally, nothing is copied.
I tried with between different accounts, in both directions, with the same result.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
1.47, 1.47 betas and 1.48


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
DSM 6.2


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive, Google Drive TeamDrive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone sync -v --transfers 1 --tpslimit 8 --max-transfer 740G --retries 5 --low-level-retries 3 --ignore-case-sync --ignore-existing --drive-server-side-across-configs "Drive1:Multimedia" "Drive2:Multimedia"  > logs/backup.txt 2>&1 &

body:
As a temporary solution for rclone, I suggest the following script. If the file is not copied for some time, make a duplicate of the desired file (in google drive, right click with the mouse -> make a copy), move to the right place and rename (remove the "copy of" in the file name).

It will work fine, I tried. Only copying does not work.

> As a temporary solution for rclone, I suggest the following script. If the file is not copied for some time, make a duplicate of the desired file (in google drive, right click with the mouse -> make a copy), move to the right place and rename (remove the "copy of" in the file name).
> 
> It will work fine, I tried. Only copying does not work.

Interesting.  That kind of implies that the file has got rate limited at google somehow.

> As a temporary solution for rclone, I suggest the following script. If the file is not copied for some time, make a duplicate of the desired file (in google drive, right click with the mouse -> make a copy), move to the right place and rename (remove the "copy of" in the file name).
> 
> It will work fine, I tried. Only copying does not work.

That's what I do. But something worth mentioning is that if you then run rclone copy on that copy you just manually made, it will get stuck regardless. There is something about these files that rclone does not like. I can provide public gdrive folder with 10 files that get stuck if anyone wants to do some tests on them. Folder ID is 1x2_Cb7YV_Zz1cq7KoC_4fM9Z8k3mD0K8

@isoisoiso thanks for that test directory, very useful

I can see the same problem.  Here are the times between starting the server side copy request and the error message coming back

    2019/07/03 13:16:45 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc0004bd600)
    2019/07/03 13:18:15 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc0004bd600)

    2019/07/03 13:18:15 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc00011c400)
    2019/07/03 13:19:44 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc00011c400)

    2019/07/03 13:19:44 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc00060f300)
    2019/07/03 13:21:14 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc00060f300)

    2019/07/03 13:21:14 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc00011c400)
    2019/07/03 13:22:43 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc00011c400)

All of these are exactly 89 or 90 seconds for the transaction

```
>>> 60*18+15-(60*16+45)
90
>>> 60*19+44-(60*18+15)
89
>>> 60*21+14-(60*19+44)
90
>>> 60*22+43-(60*21+14)
89
```

Which makes me think this must be a timeout issue at google.  I searched for bug on the [google issue tracker](https://issuetracker.google.com/issues?q=componentid:191650) bug I couldn't find a relevant one.

> AirExplorer can copy them just fine.

Any chance you could find out exactly what AirExplorer is sending in the HTTP request? You might need to use something like [burp suite](https://www.google.com/search?q=burp+suite+intercept+https) to intercept the https traffic.

For comparison this is what rclone sends

```
2019/07/03 13:22:43 DEBUG : POST /drive/v3/files/1Uz-iyOeP_zqyzJBAm12jWuFmf5DZCQbq/copy?alt=json&fields=id%2Cname%2Csize%2Cmd5Checksum%2Ctrashed%2CmodifiedTime%2CcreatedTime%2CmimeType%2Cparents%2CwebViewLink&keepRevisionForever=false&prettyPrint=false&supportsTeamDrives=false HTTP/1.1
Host: www.googleapis.com
User-Agent: rclone/v1.48.0-DEV
Content-Length: 206
Authorization: XXXX
Content-Type: application/json
Accept-Encoding: gzip

{
  "description": "file name",
  "mimeType": "application/octet-stream",
  "modifiedTime": "2019-07-02T17:29:17.600000000Z",
  "name": "file name",
  "parents": [
    "root"
  ]
}
```

I tried out a couple of variants of the above request using different parameters via curl and the API explorer available at https://developers.google.com/drive/api/v3/reference/files/copy.

Looks like the issue is with the `mimeType`. As soon as I don't specify a mimeType in the request it starts working.

I have been able to replicate similar behaviour on my own files which failed to copy server-side. Their original mimeType was `video/x-matroska` which timed out after ~90s with the same error but if I tried copying the same files with the mimeType set to `application/octet-stream` or even no mimeType, it works.

Super debugging @darthShadow well done :-)

I tried the example above and it worked perfectly.

I made a beta of rclone with this change in for everyone to try

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.48.0-062-gde20031e-fix-3070-drive-copy-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Just looking at [the docs for server side copy](https://developers.google.com/drive/api/v3/reference/files/copy) some more.

> Creates a copy of a file and applies any requested updates with patch semantics.

So setting the mime type is perfectly allowed.  It not working must be classed a s a bug.

What I conjecture is happening is that if you attempt to set the mime type (maybe to something different) then google is doing an actual copy of the file which is taking a very long time (since it is large) and failing after a 90s timeout.  When I tried the above on a large file without mime type it copied instantly indicating drive wasn't copying the actual data (kind of like a hard link on unix).

I'm not really sure why rclone was setting the mime type - it isn't necessary on a copy at all.

I am not really sure whether skipping the mime type is the correct solution, to be honest. If the mime type is not set, then the new file has the mime type by default as `application/octet-stream` which is binary and may break things which expect the copied file to have the correct mime type or the same mime type as the original.

Perhaps, this could be a flag instead and we could add a note regarding the 500 error without this flag enabled?
Btw, did the builds fail to compile? I don't see the linux builds present

> I made a beta of rclone with this change in for everyone to try

I tried. All my files began to be copied with the active flag "--disable Copy", but I did not include it.
My command line:  remote1:dest remote2:dest --progress
